routes.name: Atlantic Coast Route
routes.description: Follow Europe's mighty western border from Scandinavia to Portugal
routes.fullDescription: This route follows Europe's mighty western border, reaching from Scandinavia to South and Western Portugal, traversing majestic fjords of Norway, the wild Irish coastline, the rough cliffs of Brittany and the sun-kissed beaches of Portugal. Experience bustling port cities and cosy fishing villages alongside dramatic landscapes and regional cuisine.
routes.terrainDescription: Mix of dedicated cycle paths, minor roads, and some gravel sections. Coastal routes with varying elevation, particularly challenging in Norwegian fjord region.
routes.practicalInfo: Summer months offer optimal conditions. Winter cycling possible but challenging, especially in Scandinavia. Ferry crossings required between some sections. GPX tracks available for developed sections.

routes.name: Capitals Route
routes.description: Connect six European capitals on an epic 5,000 km cycling journey
routes.fullDescription: Dublin, London, Berlin, Warsaw, Minsk and Moscow: six compelling but different cities united by the Capitals Route. Enjoy first-class dining, partying and culture in the capitals and other cities along the route, combined with beautiful scenery such as the untouched Bia≈Çowie≈ºa Forest between Poland and Belarus, or Snowdonia National Park in the UK.
routes.terrainDescription: Mix of urban cycling and countryside routes. Flat terrain through Netherlands and Germany, rolling hills in UK. Well-developed cycle paths in Western Europe, variable conditions in Eastern sections.
routes.practicalInfo: Parts of route under development in Eastern Europe. Visa requirements for Belarus and Russia. Excellent cycling infrastructure in Netherlands and Germany. Multiple guides available for Western sections.

routes.name: Pilgrims Route
routes.description: Follow ancient pilgrimage paths to Santiago de Compostela
routes.fullDescription: The Pilgrims Route combines culture and nightlife on an epic 5,650 km journey connecting famous pilgrimage sites across Europe. Experience some of the continent's most impressive religious buildings, including the magnificent cathedrals of Cologne, Aachen and Santiago de Compostela, while passing through exciting cities renowned for nightlife including Hamburg, Li√®ge, and Paris. The route concludes at Cape Finisterre, considered to be the end of the known world for many centuries.
routes.terrainDescription: Varied terrain following historic pilgrimage routes. River valleys, vineyard regions, and mountain approaches to the Pyrenees. Mix of dedicated paths and minor roads.
routes.practicalInfo: Connects with famous Camino de Santiago pilgrimage. Great cultural and culinary experiences in cities like Hamburg, Li√®ge, and Paris. Bikeline and ADFC guides available for detailed planning.

routes.name: Central Europe Route
routes.description: Journey across Europe from the Atlantic to Eastern Europe
routes.fullDescription: Cycling 5,100 km across Europe from west to east provides a fascinating insight into the world's second most densely populated continent. The journey encompasses outstanding medieval architecture, dynamic cities, dramatic French coastlines featuring Mont-Saint-Michel, the Pink Granite Coast and Cap Fr√©hel, and the fairy tale Bohemian Forest. Despite passing through densely populated regions, there are plenty of opportunities to escape the crowds.
routes.terrainDescription: Varied terrain from dramatic French coastlines to river valleys and the Bohemian Forest. Mix of flat sections through Netherlands and Germany with hillier terrain in Czechia.
routes.practicalInfo: Partially developed with some sections under planning. Bikeline cycle maps available for German sections. Czech cycling routes have certified cycle-friendly services.

routes.name: Via Romea Francigena
routes.description: Trace the legendary pilgrimage path from Canterbury to Rome
routes.fullDescription: EuroVelo 5 follows an ancient pilgrimage route spanning over a thousand years of history. Cyclists can trace the legendary path that pilgrims once traveled from England to Rome, and historically continued to Jerusalem via Brindisi along the ancient Via Appia. The route features over 20 cathedrals alongside major European institutions in Brussels, Luxembourg, and Strasbourg, blending contemporary infrastructure with historical landmarks through the Po River Plain, Tuscany Hills, and Southern Apennines.
routes.terrainDescription: Challenging and varied terrain including Alpine crossing, Tuscan hills, and Apennine mountains. River plains provide flatter sections. Ancient Roman roads in southern sections.
routes.practicalInfo: Historic pilgrimage route with rich cultural heritage. Channel crossing required. Alpine section challenging but rewarding. Best avoided in peak summer heat for Italian sections.

routes.name: Atlantic - Black Sea
routes.description: Europe's most popular route along the Loire and Danube rivers
routes.fullDescription: One of Europe's most popular long-distance cycling routes, stretching from the Atlantic coast to the Black Sea. The route follows major European rivers, particularly the Loire and Danube, through diverse landscapes including vineyards, castles, and picturesque towns. The relatively flat terrain and excellent infrastructure make it accessible to cyclists of varying abilities, featuring coasts, rivers, castles, and top-class cycling paths.
routes.terrainDescription: Predominantly flat terrain along river valleys. World-renowned Loire and Danube cycle paths with excellent surfaces. Gentle gradients suitable for all fitness levels.
routes.practicalInfo: Train stations every 5km in Austria for flexible planning. Numerous Bed+Bike accommodations welcome single-night stays. Best infrastructure in Western sections. One of the most beginner-friendly long-distance routes.

routes.name: Sun Route
routes.description: From the midnight sun to the Mediterranean archipelago
routes.fullDescription: The Sun Route stretches from northern Europe's midnight sun regions to the Mediterranean archipelago, connecting diverse landscapes and cultures across the continent. This epic 7,650 km journey encompasses culture, sunlight, mountains and a good dose of history through a succession of European cycling destinations, including traversing the Alps, reaching Italy's southern tip, and island hopping through Malta's sunny archipelago.
routes.terrainDescription: Extremely varied terrain from Arctic tundra to Mediterranean islands. Includes challenging Alpine crossing. Flat sections through Germany and Denmark contrast with mountainous regions.
routes.practicalInfo: Ferry crossings required: Helsingborg-Helsingor, Gedser-Rostock, and Italy-Malta. Train stations every 5km in Austria. Bett+Bike accommodations available. Summer months essential for northern sections.

routes.name: Mediterranean Route
routes.description: Sparkling seas, golden beaches, and ancient cities along the Mediterranean
routes.fullDescription: EuroVelo 8 connects Mediterranean destinations spanning nearly 7,350 kilometers of coastal cycling. Experience sparkling emerald seas, kilometres of golden sand, mysterious islands, wonderful food, and ancient cities. From Gaudi's architecture and the Alhambra Palace in Spain to the romance of Venice's canals and Dubrovnik's medieval old town, this route offers diverse culinary experiences and a mix of popular tourist destinations with undiscovered gems.
routes.terrainDescription: Coastal cycling with varied terrain. Some flat sections along beaches, hillier terrain in Croatia and Greece. Hot Mediterranean climate in summer. Mix of dedicated paths and coastal roads.
routes.practicalInfo: Avoid peak summer months due to heat and crowds. Spring and autumn ideal for cycling. Ferry crossings available between some sections. Rich culinary experiences throughout.

routes.name: Baltic - Adriatic
routes.description: Follow the ancient Amber Route from the Baltic to the Adriatic Sea
routes.fullDescription: EuroVelo 9 traces the historic Amber Route that once transported Baltic amber to Mediterranean markets. This 2,050 km journey from the Baltic coast to the Adriatic Sea passes through welcoming communities in six nations, featuring diverse landscapes including rivers, seas and mountains. Experience Baltic coastal rides, Alpine passages, Mediterranean swimming, local culinary traditions and charming spa towns.
routes.terrainDescription: Varied terrain following historic trade route. Flat Baltic coast, rolling hills through Czechia, Alpine passages, and Mediterranean finish. Good cycling infrastructure throughout.
routes.practicalInfo: Historic Amber Route with rich trading heritage. Excellent spa towns for rest days. Well-developed cycling infrastructure in Austria. Shorter than most EuroVelo routes - completable in 2-3 weeks.

routes.name: Baltic Sea Cycle Route
routes.description: Circumnavigate the Baltic Sea through nine countries
routes.fullDescription: EuroVelo 10 is an epic circumnavigation of the Baltic Sea spanning 9,100 km. The route traverses diverse landscapes including beaches, cliffs, woodland, ports, marinas and thousands of islands. Experience five capital cities, Hanseatic heritage towns, and diverse coastal ecosystems connecting multiple Northern European cultures.
routes.terrainDescription: Diverse coastal landscapes including beaches, cliffs, woodland, ports and marinas. Thousands of islands large and small. Surface conditions vary by region from well-developed cycling paths to gravel roads.
routes.practicalInfo: Summer months offer optimal cycling conditions. Download official GPX tracks before departure. Consult region-specific Bikeline guides for detailed maps. Plan accommodations using cycling service directories.

routes.name: East Europe Route
routes.description: The 'Beast of the East' from Norway to Greece through 11 countries
routes.fullDescription: Nicknamed the 'Beast of the East' by bicycle tourists, this epic 6,750 km route stretches from the north-east tip of Norway all the way down to sunny Greece. The journey showcases six distinct capital cities and passes through extremely different landscapes and cultures across Eastern Europe, from Nordic fjords to Mediterranean beaches.
routes.terrainDescription: Extremely varied terrain from Arctic tundra to Mediterranean coast. Mix of well-developed sections and areas under development. Some challenging unpaved sections in Eastern Europe.
routes.practicalInfo: Earned the nickname 'Beast of the East' due to its length and challenging nature. Varying development status along the route. Use EuroVelo Route Planner tool for trip organization. Summer months essential for northern sections.

routes.name: North Sea Cycle Route
routes.description: Diverse landscapes from Dutch polders to Norwegian 300m cliffs
routes.fullDescription: The North Sea Cycle Route will surprise you with its diversity. Although bordering the same sea, it goes from land located below sea level in the Netherlands to cliffs of 300 meters in height in Norway. Experience well-maintained Danish cycle paths, Scottish distilleries, modern port cities like Gothenburg and Hamburg, inviting Dutch beaches, and Norwegian fjords requiring scenic ferry crossings.
routes.terrainDescription: Dramatic contrasts from land below sea level in Netherlands to 300m cliffs in Norway. Well-maintained Danish cycle paths. Flat Dutch sections and varied terrain along Scottish coast.
routes.practicalInfo: Summer months optimal as some ferries operate seasonally only. Check ferry timetables in advance - essential in Norway for fjord crossings. Multiple ferry connections: Sweden-Denmark, Channel crossings. Orkney requires ferries from John o' Groats or Thurso.

routes.name: Iron Curtain Trail
routes.description: A living history lesson along the former East-West divide
routes.fullDescription: This epic route traces the former border dividing Europe into East and West, stretching from the Barents Sea to the Black Sea. The trail offers a living history lesson while providing a welcome reminder of the peace and reconciliation that followed the fall of the 'Curtain'. Recognized by the European Parliament as a model project for sustainable tourism and designated as a Cultural Route of the Council of Europe.
routes.terrainDescription: Considerable variety from vineyards in southern Czechia and northern Austria to mountainous Bulgarian-Greek border. Bustling Baltic ports to stark beauty of Lapland. Mix of surfaces varying by region.
routes.practicalInfo: A living history lesson tracing Europe's division. Summer months recommended. Bed+Bike accommodations in Austria with secure parking. Train stations every 5km in Austrian sections for flexible travel. Bikeline guides available for detailed planning.

routes.name: Waters of Central Europe
routes.description: Rivers, lakes and spas across Austria and Hungary
routes.fullDescription: A pleasant route linking rivers, lakes and spas across Austria and Hungary. This route provides an important east-west connection and features multiple thermal spa towns ideal for cyclist relaxation. With train stations approximately every 5 km in Austria and certified Bed+Bike accommodations, it's well-suited for both leisurely rides and long-distance adventures.
routes.terrainDescription: Water-themed geography connecting rivers, lakes and spas. Follows riverside and lake landscapes with varied terrain across central European geography. Generally easy cycling along waterways.
routes.practicalInfo: Train stations every 5km in Austrian sections for flexible travel. Certified Bett+Bike accommodations welcome single-night stays with secure bike parking. Excellent train connectivity for weather-based flexibility.

routes.name: Rhine Cycle Route
routes.description: Follow the Rhine from the Swiss Alps to the North Sea
routes.fullDescription: Suitable for cyclists of all fitness levels and abilities, the Rhine Cycle Route runs along one of the longest rivers in Europe from the Swiss Alps to the North Sea. Explore the cultural and economic heritage fostered by the Rhine over 2,000 years, showcasing picturesque towns, villages, vineyards, castles, and industrial heritage sites. The romantic section between Mainz and Cologne features steep hillsides and castle ruins.
routes.terrainDescription: Suitable for all fitness levels. Generally follows river valley with well-developed cycling infrastructure. Alpine terrain at source transitioning to flat delta toward the coast. Romantic section features steep hillsides.
routes.practicalInfo: Well-connected to public transport services in all countries crossed. Cyclist-friendly accommodations throughout. One-way bike rental services available. Summer months optimal for events and best weather conditions.

routes.name: Rhone Cycle Route
routes.description: From Alpine peaks to Mediterranean beaches via lavender fields
routes.fullDescription: Following the course of the River Rhone, this route travels over 1,000 km to the beautiful Mediterranean coast of France. The shortest EuroVelo route packs in a surprising amount of different cultures, landscapes and experiences - from Alpine scenery to Lake Geneva, through Provence's lavender fields to the Camargue's wild white horses.
routes.terrainDescription: Varied topography from alpine terrain over 2,400m to sea-level Mediterranean coast. Follows River Rhone throughout. Mix of developed ViaRh√¥na cycling paths and sections under development.
routes.practicalInfo: Shortest EuroVelo route but packs diverse experiences. Alpine start requires good fitness. ViaRh√¥na platform provides detailed French section information. Bikeline guides available for both Swiss and French sections.

routes.name: Meuse Cycle Route
routes.description: Follow the Meuse from source to the North Sea through charming villages
routes.fullDescription: The Meuse Cycle Route follows one of the most important rivers in Europe across three nations. It welcomes cyclists of all abilities with ever-changing scenery, charming towns and villages on both banks of the river, plus plenty of cultural heritage sites and culinary treasures including WWI historical sites near Verdun and the stunning French and Belgian Ardennes.
routes.terrainDescription: Easy rides suitable for families. Charming riverside cycling through varied landscapes - French forests, Belgian valleys, and Dutch waterways. Gentle terrain throughout.
routes.practicalInfo: Welcomes cyclists of all abilities. Spring offers beautiful riverside blossoms. Bikeline guide available with 1:75,000 scale maps. Good public transport integration. WWI historical sites near Verdun provide poignant rest stops.
